title: Cops Don’t Need RIGHTS, Cycling Saves 4.13.21
itunes:title: Cops Don’t Need RIGHTS, Cycling Saves 4.13.21
description:
In episode 856, Jack and Miles are joined by American Hysteria's Chelsey Weber-Smith to discuss the killing of Daunte Wright by Minneapolis police, Maryland's sweeping police reform, the police bill of rights, Michigan's covid numbers, France banning short flights, and more!

FOOTNOES:

  1. Police Chief Claims Cop Who Killed Minnesota Black Man Accidentally Fired Gun Instead of Taser
  2. Maryland Passes Sweeping Police Reform Legislation
  3. There’s a reason it’s hard to discipline police. It starts with a bill of rights 47 years ago.
  4. Covid-19 Live Updates: C.D.C. Director Says Michigan Should Shut Down to Slow Outbreak
  5. France moves to ban short-haul domestic flights
  6. LISTEN: K, Le Maestro - BMO 2001 (BREAK MISSY OFF)

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
